sub_title: Interdisciplinary projectmanagement, sensorial design and spatial experiences to enhance well-being
summary:
Approach

Studio Kontou creates spatial experiences and sensorial interiors to enhance well-being and mindfulness in particular. Central to Kontou's work is the holistic integration of mindful design, natural elements and art; all to stimulate the senses. With a multi-disciplinary network, Kontou puts together the best team for each project, to be able to create qualitative experiences and interiors.

Research as base

Biophilic design and related research serve as a steady platform for Kontou. Taking nature as the greatest example and source of inspiration, its restorative and relaxing qualities are being translated in holistic environments. To benefit the physical and mental state of its beholders and elating sensory awareness into everyday life.
Extensive research in various fields as introspection, serenity and mindful interconnection, led to launching the first multi sensorial experience “Contemplation Spaces” during Dutch Design Week 2017. Followed by research project The Design of Spatial Well-being to investigate methods and developments to create healthy environments, in a broader perspective. 

The Founder 

Justine Kontou, educated as a commercial economist with degrees in trend forecasting & concept development, is specialised in art and design. Her years as curator and projectmanager a.o. for Eindhoven365 and Dutch Design Week led to Justine combining these elements with the purpose of affecting wellbeing. 
Justine is about strategy without losing the imperative creativity and finesse to visualise and materialise her beliefs. Her purpose is to create meaningful, healthy environments that are soothing and empathetic to its users. This holistic approach in optimising the whole spatial experience to enhance well-being, is still very new and innovative. By nurturing her infinite curiosity for the sake of new insights and additional experts to work with, she keeps ahead of social developments.

treasury_media.title: A feature in the June issue of Livingetc about my work around sensory design
treasury_media.description:
Already some months ago Ellen Finch interviewed me about my work around sensory design for the interior design magazine Livingetc. Among other things, we talked about how to create a soothing, restorative space - from using acoustic materials to creating links with nature through art and design, for example simulating water reflections. 

#livingetc #sensorialdesign #senses #wellbeing #art #design #biophilicdesign #attentionrestorationtheory #sensorialcurator #sensorialartdirector #kontou

projects.title: OXI exhibition
projects.description:
OXI was a thoroughly curated exhibition at Sectie C, during Dutch Design Week 2015, with design, art, photography and (interactive) installations.
In my role as curator, I selected expressive visual pieces to show a broad spectrum of contemporary design and art. Tessa Koot was the art director. The design of the exhibition expressed how artists and designers are currently positioned by the creative industry. Since OXI was more than a exposition only; it aimed to draw attention to the social problem that alternative business models for designers and artists are urgently needed.
With OXI we presented a new exhibition concept. Govert Flint showed a possible alternative business model for designers and artists in the exhibition. By measuring and analyzing the emotional respond of visitors to the items with help of software, using cameras. 
The aim of our concept is to stimulate a public debate to jointly restore the occupational form of work for talented designers and artists.

projects.title: IT'S WEEKEND: Fashion X Cult
projects.description:
Opdrachtgever: Gemeente Eindhoven, Eindhoven365, SOEC

profile_positions.description: What if Lab is a platform to activate and facilitate collaboration between designers and clients (businesses, governments and institutions). A platform that deploys creative thinking power for the design of our common future. What if Lab offers a clear framework to discover how designers and design methods can support (long-term) organizations in developing and researching solutions for complex issues.
profile_positions.title: Lab Manager What if Lab

profile_positions.description:
Justine Kontou - curator, art director, creative concepts and visualization of future scenarios. With her eye for colours, textures and shapes, she is able to create esthetic and eclectic experiences.

Educated as a commercial economist (HEAO) and as a stylist at Academie Artemis in Amsterdam, Justine Kontou brings the perfect mix between creative and commercial. She knows how to put up strategies without losing the necessary creativity and skills to visualise these concepts. With her multidisciplinary approach and social skills, she brings people together in a way that feels natural to participators. An important quality mandatory to most projects. 

Due to her curiosity, imagination and open-minded view, she can easily ‘see’ important cultural and social developments and translate these into possible future scenario’s. With her eye for colours, textures and shapes, she is able to create esthetic and eclectic experiences (both 2D and 3D). 

Most of the time her work consists of combining disciplines like photography, art, design and installations. 

"My drive is to create, to be meaningful and to contribute to change. By creating multi-sensorial experiences to enhance the well-being in spaces, my goal is to create an environment that’s soothing and comfortable for it’s users. By letting them experience the positive effects of art and nature, they are stimulated to enter into their natural strength." 

Types of work: 
° Creating spatial experiences to enhance the well-being in spaces
° Curator and art director of artistic projects, like exhibitions, events and fairs 
° Translating strategy and targets of clients into creative and visual concepts 
° Trend forecasts, inspirational moodboards and visualization 
° Project management for Art/ Design projects
profile_positions.title: Sensorial curator & art director

profile_positions.description:
Contemplation Spaces function as spots that allow you to disconnect yourself from your daily life and mind. In these spaces your senses will be stimulated by a fine selection of art, design, sound, tactility, and also by the use of scent, to immediately put you in a different mindstate.
Due to distinct and unique features of selected objects and installations, you consider yourself in a world of its own. This one of a kind atmosphere is enhanced by water-themed installations, the usage of a variety of tactile materials, and matching fragrances and audio to create the best experience possible. To execute this concept, I collaborated with architect Lex Hildenbrant, psychologist Florijn Vriend, students of University of Amsterdam and a wide selection of twenty designers and experts. Research has been done on existing scientific studies that focus on the stress-reducing effects of art, light, sound and (references) to nature.

The first edition will take place in The Student Hotel Eindhoven during Dutch Design Week, from 21 to 29 of October. Everyone is invited to experience Contemplation Spaces themselves. Visitors’ feedback will be collected and used for further development, to create permanent Contemplation Spaces. These permanent locations could be hotels, workspaces but also healthcare facilities or residential communities. The final goal is that as many people as possible can one day benefit from the stress reductive effects of art and design. 

To finance its experimental launch & research during DDW 2017, I started a crowdfunding campaign hosted by voordekunst.nl. Contemplation Spaces is the result of a deep collaboration between artists, designers, and scientists who believe in the importance of creating healthier, more peaceful spaces to balance out the stressors presented by modern living. As a work of passion, the project is unpaid, yet requires significant time and money to bring to fruition. Until 4 October you can find the campaign through the link below.
profile_positions.title: Initiator & Curator of Contemplation Spaces
Projectleader & jury chairman DAE School Awards + Planetree Design Award

profile_positions.description: Space&Matter is an Amsterdam-based studio for spatial and strategic design. With an integrated design approach, we develop thriving neighbourhoods: places that create a sense of community and bring about positive changes. We believe that resilient cities are, first and foremost, created by the people who live in them. We exist to translate the needs of these people into designs that make them feel at home, on the one hand, and improve the health of the planet, on the other.
profile_positions.title: Public Relations Communications Manager

profile_positions.description:
Dutch Design Foundation has commissioned Justine Kontou for a variety of projects since 2012. A multidisciplinary approach and connecting design/art with business/retail can be seen as the main focus of this collaboration. Most of these projects were executed for the likes of the annually held event Dutch Design Week. Justine Kontou was entitled project manager in most of these cases. 

Some examples:
- Project management for the exhibition MAARTEN BAAS MAKES TIME during Dutch Design Week 2016.
- Justine Kontou created a strategic format for custom-made tours during Dutch Design Week (2014, 2015 and 2016). This way she connected companies and government institutions with matching designers to encourage possible future collaborations and/or projects. 
- Another example is a custom-made program Justine set up for a group of designers from Beijing in July 2015. This program consisted of five days of lectures and visits to a variety of different Dutch Designers and Design studios. 
- Justine Kontou executed different projects to visualise the substantive collaboration between main sponsor ABN AMRO and Dutch Design Week. For example, the annually held ABN AMRO DDW preview (2014 and 2015) but also by creating inspiring programs and custom-made tours during Dutch Design Week for ABN AMRO officials. (2014, 2015 and 2016). 
- In 2015, she also was in charge of concept and execution (again as project manager) of different projects to visualise the substantive collaboration between partner Eneco and Dutch Design Week. This partnership led to a variety of activities such as “Toon design challenge”, “Eneco laadplein” and “Smart home day” during Dutch Design Week 2015.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager at Dutch Design Foundation

profile_positions.description: - Communication for Dutch Design Week 2013, including assistance of the editorial staff (Dailies on Tour) for the daily DDW paper by order of Dutch Design Week organization, Capital D.
profile_positions.title: Communication

profile_positions.description: In 2013, the projects Justine managed for Dutch Design Foundation were mainly focused on attracting Dutch Design Week visitors to the city centre of Eindhoven. She connected designers and retailers in order to show a diverse audience the works of talented designers displayed in windows of different shops throughout the city centre of Eindhoven. Therefore, she revised the strategy for this project by creating less (36) Design Windows, but improving quality by making custom-made matches between designers and retailers. Justine also expanded the program by initiating an evening program in collaboration with retailers, restaurants, bars and designers. The result was a cutting edge program throughout the city centre of Eindhoven which really complemented existing exhibitions and activities set up by Dutch Design Week. .
profile_positions.title: Design windows

profile_positions.description: 24 hours a week. Main tasks: coaching and motivation of sales team at the 1e floor (Fashion department), administrative tasks and member of different work groups concerning premium service and customer experience.
profile_positions.title: Eerste medewerker Sales at Bijenkorf Eindhoven

profile_positions.description: 32 hours a week. Main tasks: coaching and motivation of the whole sales team, monitoring of the turnover figures, implementation of central sale action in the store, as well as administrative tasks.
profile_positions.title: Team manager Sales at Bijenkorf Den Bosch

profile_positions.description:
Eindhoven365 has a primary focus on the development of the brand Eindhoven and brand management with a strong focus on design, technology and knowledge, the core qualities of the Eindhoven Region. To create a better involvement of  the city center of Eindhoven during Dutch Design Week, Eindhoven365 initiated a special project: Unexpected Interaction. 
In my role as project manager for Unexpected Interaction I developed, together with Daan Melis, a concept to connect designers, retailers/ restaurants and cultural institutions and I organized the whole project. Which resulted in an energetic city center during Dutch Design Week 2013; at six different public squares in the city center appeared design installations created by Nacho Carbonell, Maarten Baas, Kiki en Joost, La Bolleur, Lucas Maassen en Martin Schuurmans. The squares were connected with a laser beam to create a route through ‘Area Innercity’. Nex to this, I connected 36 shops, restaurants and cafés with 36 different designers for expositions and other special events to complete Unexptected Interaction. All the locations were signed with special displays made by Joost Gehem, Tiddo Bakker and Victor Sonna (all members of Collaboration-O).
profile_positions.title: Project Manager Unexpected Interaction during Dutch Design Week 2012

profile_positions.description:
“Collected is a styling and concepts agency, that consists of two all-round stylists/organizers that put everything aside to create a mind-blowing outcome of every project they work on”

We are continuously studying developments in society to understand the upcoming trends of the future. With all that information – as well as the inspiration we picked up on the way – we are creating concepts for companies that are linked to fashion.

Styling is one of the main ingredients for our concepts, along with innovative trends and marketing. We think concepts should draw all the attention by being different, innovative and by telling a story of there own. Therefore we don’t border our creativity to fashion, we also seek inspiration in the field of architecture, design, music, lifestyle etc.

Our mission is to create concepts for companies, that are truly distinctive and also help reach the goals of the concerning company. Depending on the project, we create and perform a concept on our own, or we unite talents, visions and ideas to create and/or perform a concept together. In the second case, we act as a mediator. We create the concept and bring creative talents and commercial companies together to create a win-win situation for all parties. We will organize everything and make sure there is clear communication and planning during the project

Examples of our projects:
- trend forecasts for (concept)stores and labels
- events for (concept) stores and  labels like fashion shows, expositions etc.
- photoshoots for (concept) stores, labels and magazines
profile_positions.title: Co-founder
